Name: CodeListName
Description: A name for the CodeList. May be expressed in multiple languages. Repeat the element to express names with different content, for example different names for different systems.

Name: Label
Description: A display label for the CodeList. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content. Repeat for labels with different content, for example, labels with differing length limitations.

Name: Description
Description: A description of the content and purpose of the CodeList. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Name: RecommendedDataType
Description: This field provides the recommended treatment of the data within an application. This field is important as some codes represented as numeric should be treated as strings, i.e., many standardized codes for industry, occupation, education, etc. The value should come from a controlled vocabulary - recommended values include the set found in W3C XML Schema Part 2, but excluding string sub-types, QNAME, and NOTATION.

Name: CodeListReference
Description: Allows for inclusion by reference of another CodeList. Care must be taken to ensure that all code values of the resulting CodeList are unique.

Name: CategorySchemeReference
Description: Reference to a default category scheme, with the assumption that all categories referenced by the subsequent codes are part of it, unless overwritten by the scheme reference in the CategoryReference field of the code.

Name: HierarchyType
Description: Identifies the type of hierarchy used in the nesting of categories. Possible values are Regular and Irregular. A regular nesting indicates that the category hierarchy is consistent at all lower levels of the hierarchy, i.e., the lowest levels of the hierarchy are at the same level for every branch on the hierarchy.

Name: Level
Description: Describes the levels of the code hierarchy. The level describes the nesting structure of a hierarchical coding structure. Note that the attribute levelNumber is used for referencing specific codes to their level identifier.

Name: Code
Description: Includes a code value, references the category label, and describes the code's position in a hierarchy.

Name: IsSystemMissingValue
Description: If "true" contents are used to represent system specific missing values. The default value is "false".
